This step you only need to do once ‐ one registry can contain multiple different webviz applications simultaneously
An Azure container registry (ACR) is a private Docker registry in Azure where you can store and manage Docker containers.
  1. Go to Azure Portal and sign in.
  2. Select Create a resource > Containers > Container Registry.
  3. Choose a name for your new container registry. We will later refer to this as ACRNAME.
  4. Select the location nearest your office and/or the one compliant with your data management.
  5. Choose the Basic SKU plan for cost optimization.
  6. Click Create and you are done.

If not already installed, you should install the Microsoft Azure Client tool. This will make it easy to communicate with your Azure subscription.

In order to give the Azure command line client access, run 

az login --use-device-code
and open the link you are presented in a browser. Type the one time token, and you are now logged in.

You should also set the subscription you want to use, e.g.

az account set --subscription 'MySubscription'

Source: Azure container registry - get started
